item.description:
@MeeE59 wrote:

Hey, it’s me once more. I’m still looking for things regarding particle generation in 667+ clients. Since I can’t post again in my last topic, I figured It’d be better if I made a new one. Here goes:

What I’m looking for is any information regarding the way particles are generated on models. I know how to add them, but I have no idea which type I’m attaching to faces (will it be smoke? snow? fire? some colorful blobs?). I’d like to know what it would be that defines the pattern. I have been informed that it’s OpenGL, but that wasn’t much help with finding where the client reads them from and how it displays them.

I’ve tried following the path from how the client reads the model (which is where you assign the type value and what face it appears on), but with Jagex’s seemingly random multiplication (like this:

Class85(int i, int i_0_, int i_1_, int i_2_, byte i_3_) { ((Class85) this).anInt778 = i * 2033948917; anInt773 = 1451019569 * i_0_; anInt774 = i_1_ * 1631001933; anInt775 = 383276227 * i_2_; aByte780 = i_3_; }
), it made it very confusing and extremely hard to follow. I hit a brick wall at that point, since I have no idea what those numbers mean (if anything but to obscure the goal).

Anyway, any help is appreciated. Thanks for looking!
